text: INF3707 MAY/JUNE 2018 DELLZ SECTION A: MCQ 1.1	 C 1.2	 D 1.3	 B 1.4	 C 1.5	 C 1.6	 B 1.7	 A 1.8	 D 1.9	 A 1.10	 C 1.11	 A 1.12	 B 1.13	 D 1.14	 B 1.15	 C SECTION B: QUESTIONS QUESTION 2 2.1	 When multiple tables have a common column name, the column must be preﬁxed with 	 the table name. eg. tablename.columnname That is a column qualiﬁer, it shows the table containing the column being referenced. 2.2	 JOIN USING Is used when there is a common column(s) between the joint table(s) 	 JOIN…ON is used when there are no commonly named columns to use. 2.3	 SELECT b.title, (oi.paideach - b.cost) AS “PROFIT”, ﬁrstname, orderdate 		 FROM customers, orders, books b JOIN orderiterms oi 		 USING (isbn) 		 WHERE ﬁrstname = (SELECT ﬁrstname 						 FROM customers 						 WHERE ﬁrstname = ‘JAKE’) 	 ORDER BY orderdate; 2.4	 SELECT b.title, c.state,c.ﬁrstname,o.order# 	 FROM books b,orders o LEFT OUTER JOIN customers c 	 USING (customer#); 2.5	 SELECT SUM (oi.quantity*oi.paideach-b.cost) AS "TOTAL PROFIT", AVG (oi.quantity*oi.paideach-b.cost) AS "AVERAGE PROFIT" FROM orders, orderitems oi JOIN books b USING (isbn) GROUP BY orders.order#; QUESTION 3 3.1	 CREATE TABLE client_data (member_id NUMBER (10), last_name VARCHAR2 (25), address VARCHAR2 (100), city VARCHAR2 (30), phone# VARCHAR2 (10), join_date DATE); 3.2	 ALTER TABLE client_data 	 ADD CONSTRAINT client_data_member_id_pk PRIMARY KEY (member_id); 	 Syntax 	 ALTER TABLE tablename 	 ADD CONSTRAINT constraintname PRIMARY KEY (columnname); 3.3	 ALTER TABLE client_data 	 MODIFY phone# CONSTRAINT c_d_phone#_nn NOT NULL; 	 Syntax 	 ALTER TABLE tablename 	 MODIFY column CONSTRAINT constraintname NOT NULL; 3.4	 ALTER TABLE client_data 	 MODIFY phone# VARCHAR2 (13); 3.5	 GRANT SELECT, INSERT 	 ON client_data 	 TO Scott 	 WITH GRANT OPTION; 3.6	 CREATE SEQUENCE Client_Data_ID_Seq 	 INCREMENT BY 1 	 START WITH 101 	 MAXVALUE 5000 	 NOCACHE; 3.9	 ALTER TABLE client_data 	 DROP COLUMN next_of_kin; 3.10	 CREATE SYNONYM CLIENTDET 	 FOR client_data_Id_seq; 3.11	 CREATE INDEX last_name_idx 	 ON client_data(last_name); 	 SELECT table_name,index_name,index_type FROM user_indexes WHERE table_name = 'client_data';
